title: The Lost Expedition
description: A group of 'Ley-Line Seekers' has vanished in the 'Singing Gorges'. They were carrying a portable World-Spark tuner.

turns.narrative: The 'Singing Gorges' hum with a dissonant, bone-vibrating sound. The air is thick with a yellow haze that tastes of sulfur and ancient dust.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You isolate a human scream hidden within the gorge's song. (+1 Clue)
turns.consequence_b: Success: The needle points toward a cave mouth higher up the cliff. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: You find the remains of their basecamp—tents shredded from the inside out.

turns.narrative: The camp is covered in Frost-Burned markings. These aren't animal tracks; they are glyph-prints left by 'Echo-Ghouls'.
turns.consequence_a: Success: These ghouls feed on the memories of those who die in the gorge. (+1 Lore)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You find a journal detailing a 'Massive Frequency Spike' from the cave. (+1 Clue)
turns.convergence: A voice calls out from the dark of the cave—familiar, yet hollow.

turns.narrative: It is the voice of Elara, the expedition leader. She stands at the cave's edge, but her movements are jerky, like a marionette.
turns.consequence_a: Success: The light reveals three Echo-Ghouls clinging to her back. (+1 Tactical Adv)
turns.consequence_b: Failure: The Ghouls sense your empathy and lunge.
turns.convergence: The Ghouls are translucent, flickering in and out of phase with reality.

turns.narrative: Echo-Ghouls are immune to normal steel while phased out. You must strike when they solidify to feed.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You time your strike perfectly, cleaving a Ghoul in two. (+100 XP)
turns.consequence_b: Success: Your weapon glows, tearing through the ethereal forms. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Ghouls shriek in a frequency that hurts your ears, fleeing back into the cave.

turns.narrative: Elara is comatose, but her 'World-Spark Tuner' is still active, pulsing with a dangerous violet energy.
turns.consequence_a: Success: The tuner stabilizes, acting as a beacon for other survivors. (+1 Item)
turns.consequence_b: Success: You carry her out just as the cave ceiling begins to vibrate violently. (+1 Morale)
turns.convergence: Deep in the cave, a 'Frequency-Abomination'—a mass of sound and shadow—begins to emerge.

turns.narrative: The Abomination is the source of the Singing Gorges' power. It radiates a 'Sorrow-Aura' that triggers your worst memories.
turns.choice_a: Focus on your duty (Wis Save DC 14)
turns.consequence_a: Success: You push through the mental noise, your resolve hardening. (+100 XP)
turns.consequence_b: Failure: Your blade passes through the sound, dealing no damage.
turns.convergence: The Tuner in your hand begins to glow. It can be used to 'shatter' the sound-beast.

turns.narrative: The Abomination lunges, its mass vibrating so fast it looks like a blur of gray static.
turns.consequence_a: Success: A blast of pure, white frequency shatters the Abomination into harmless echoes. (+500 XP)
turns.choice_b: Lead it toward the cave exit
turns.consequence_b: Success: The natural sunlight weakens the creature, allowing a final strike. (+1 Progress)
turns.convergence: The Gorge falls silent for the first time in centuries.

turns.narrative: You find the rest of the Seekers trapped in a webbing of crystallized sound. They are weak, but alive.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You rescue the entire team. They offer you their 'Seeker’s Compass'. (+1 Item)
turns.consequence_b: Success: They can be used as high-energy batteries. (+3 Resources)
turns.convergence: Elara wakes up, her eyes clear. She remembers a 'Hidden Gate' deeper in the Gorge.

turns.narrative: The Hidden Gate is sealed with a frequency-lock that requires the Tuner. Elara asks if you want to open it.
turns.consequence_a: Success: You discover a vault containing 'Pre-Scourge Knowledge'. (+5 Lore)
turns.choice_b: Leave it sealed for the Council to decide
turns.convergence: The expedition returns to Warden-Keep as heroes.

turns.narrative: Back at the settlement, the Council is split on what to do with the Frequency-Abomination's remains.
turns.consequence_a: Success: Settlement military increases, but at a cost to morale. (+5 Defense, -2 Morale)
turns.consequence_b: Success: Morale rises as the threat is truly gone. (+5 Morale)

conclusion: The Ley-Line Seekers are safe, and the Singing Gorges have become the 'Silent Gorges'. The discovery of the pre-Scourge vault has changed everything.

risk_matrix.penalty: Expedition lost. -100 Reputation and -2 Settlement Lore progress.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

location: The Singing Gorges — Far Eastern Frontier
